title: Bay Area tech CEO lays off 931 workers with 'straight facts' email | Flipboard
text:
Bay Area tech CEO lays off 931 workers with 'straight facts' email Jack Dorsey told Block staff they were being laid off in an all-lowercase email on Tuesday Block, the Bay Area tech giant behind Square, Cash App and Afterpay, is abruptly laying off 931 workers, according to an email from CEO Jack Dorsey to workers on Tuesday. More than 200 of the employees worked …

author: Daily Excelsior
title: Prez gives assent to CEC, ECs bill - DailyExcelsior
text: NEW DELHI, Dec 29: President Droupadi Murmu has given her assent to a bill that seeks to put in place a mechanism for the appointment of Chief Election Commissioner and other Election Commissioners, according to a Government notification issued today. The Chief Election Commissioner and Other Election Commissioners (Appointment, Conditions of Service and Term of Office) Bill, 2023, has provisions to set up a search committee chaired by the Law Minister and two other persons not below the rank of Secretary, to prepare a panel of five persons for consideration of the selection committee for appointment as CEC or ECs. The bill also has provisions for a Selection Committee, chaired by the Prime Minister, Leader of the Opposition and a Union Minister, to make recommendations to the President for appointment of CEC and other ECs. The President also granted assent to the Press and Registration of Periodicals Bill, to replace a British-era law governing the publishing industry and simplify the process of registration of periodicals. The Bill replaces the Press and Registration of Books Act of 1867. Rajya Sabha passed the Bill on August 3. “This bill is simple, smart and has a simultaneous process for registration of newspapers and periodicals. Earlier newspapers or magazines had to pass through an eight-step registration process. This can now be done at the click of a button,” Union Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur said responding to the discussion on the bill in the Lok Sabha on December 21. He said newspapers and periodicals will now be able to get registered within two months as against the two to three years required earlier. The President also granted assent to the Central Goods and Services Tax (Second Amendment) Bill, 2023, and the Provisional Collection of Taxes Bill, 2023. (PTI) Prez gives assent to CEC, ECs bill NEW DELHI, Dec 29:

author: Sky UK Limited
title: UK warned to brace for further onslaught of wild weather this weekend
text: Fresh yellow weather warnings for rain, wind and snow across parts of the UK The Met Office is warning the extreme weather across the UK could lead to flooding and transport disruption. Friday 29 December 2023 18:26, UK Britons are being urged to brace for a further onslaught of wild weather following the devastation of Storm Gerrit. Gusts of up to 75mph could hit parts of the south of England and Wales on Saturday, the Met Office has warned. A yellow weather alert for wind has been issued for parts of the South East, South West, East Anglia and [Wales](https://news.sky.com/topic/wales-6259) from 11am on Saturday until 3am on New Year's Eve. A separate yellow warning for rain has been issued across part of Wales between 10am and 6pm on Saturday. A yellow rain warning has also been placed across most of Northern Ireland from 4am until 11am on Saturday, with up to 25mm of rain expected in just a few hours. In [Scotland](https://news.sky.com/topic/scotland-5866), both snow and rain are expected to batter most of the country between 8am and midnight on Saturday. UK weather: [The latest Sky News forecast](https://news.sky.com/story/uk-weather-the-latest-sky-news-forecast-11681155) The Met Office is warning the extreme [weather](https://news.sky.com/weather) across the UK could lead to flooding and transport disruption. ScotRail, LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway are among the train companies to have told passengers they should check before travelling in the coming days. The fresh warnings come on the heels of Storm Gerrit. Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) said it had restored power to almost 48,000 homes, with bosses confident the final 250 properties would be reconnected on Friday. In Wales, 36,000 properties were left without power after lightning struck in Ceredigion. Elsewhere, three men died after their 4x4 vehicle was [submerged in the River Esk](https://news.sky.com/story/yorkshire-three-men-die-after-4x4-plunges-into-river-13038772), near Glaisdale in North Yorkshire. The storm is also still being felt in northern England and Wales. Stalybridge, Tameside, and Carrbrook in Greater Manchester are in a "recovery phase", local authorities have said, after they were hit by a rare tornado that toppled trees and damaged homes. The freak whirlwind was thought to have been caused by a supercell thunderstorm, and residents said it had left some homes looking like "an absolute disaster". Read more: [Tornado hits Greater Manchester](https://news.sky.com/story/uk-weather-tornado-hits-greater-manchester-and-thousands-still-without-power-in-scotland-in-wake-of-storm-gerrit-13038743) [Hundreds of homes still without power](https://news.sky.com/story/uk-weather-hundreds-of-homes-still-without-power-after-storm-gerrit-13038949) [ ](https://news.sky.com/download-app) Be the first to get Breaking News Install the Sky News app for free Meteorologist Alex Burkill is advising all those heading out on New Year's Eve to wrap up as the mercury drops. He said: "As we look towards the end of the day on New Year's Eve, and the blustery showery theme does continue, some of those showers should start to ease as we head towards midnight. "So, perhaps a bit more drier weather around, some clearer skies, but do watch out for those showers. "And you will also want to wrap up quite warm because although it hasn't been particularly chilly recently, when you factor in those strong blustery winds, it's going to feel close to freezing for many places. "So, definitely a chilly feel to things as the clock strikes midnight."

author: @gurufocus
title: NuScale Power Corp (SMR) Launches New E2 Center at UNLV to Foster Nuclear Workforce Development
text:
NuScale Power Corp (SMR, Financial), a leader in advanced small modular reactor nuclear technology, announced the opening of its latest Energy Exploration (E2) Center at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas (UNLV). This initiative, co-funded by the U.S. Department of Energy's Nuclear Energy University Program, aims to develop a skilled nuclear-ready workforce. The E2 Center will provide students with hands-on experience in nuclear power plant operations through a state-of-the-art simulator, enhancing their learning and understanding of nuclear science and engineering. The announcement was made on October 24, 2023.
Positive Aspects
- NuScale Power Corp is expanding its educational outreach with the opening of a new E2 Center at UNLV.
- The initiative is supported by a grant from the U.S. Department of Energy, highlighting governmental backing.
- The E2 Center provides hands-on learning opportunities, preparing students for careers in nuclear energy.
- NuScale's SMR technology is the first to be certified by the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission, showcasing its industry leadership.
Negative Aspects
- The press release includes forward-looking statements, which carry inherent risks and uncertainties.
- NuScale faces intense competition in the nuclear technology sector.
- Potential challenges include project execution risks and the need for continuous capital investment.
Financial Analyst Perspective
From a financial standpoint, NuScale Power Corp's expansion of its E2 Centers is a strategic move to solidify its position in the nuclear energy sector. By investing in educational initiatives, NuScale is not only fostering a future workforce but also potentially increasing its market share by promoting its proprietary SMR technology. The backing from the U.S. Department of Energy further strengthens its financial stability and credibility. However, investors should be mindful of the forward-looking statements and the associated risks, such as project execution challenges and the need for ongoing capital investment.
Market Research Analyst Perspective
As a market research analyst, the opening of the E2 Center at UNLV represents a significant step in NuScale Power Corp's strategy to enhance its global presence and influence in the nuclear energy market. The initiative aligns with the growing demand for clean and sustainable energy solutions. By providing hands-on training and education, NuScale is addressing the skills gap in the nuclear industry, which could lead to increased adoption of its SMR technology. The company's focus on educational partnerships positions it well to capitalize on the global shift towards carbon-free energy sources.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the purpose of the E2 Center at UNLV?
The E2 Center aims to support the development of a skilled nuclear-ready workforce by providing hands-on learning opportunities in nuclear science and engineering.
Who funded the E2 Center at UNLV?
The E2 Center was co-funded by a grant from the U.S. Department of Energy's Nuclear Energy University Program.
What technology does the E2 Center use for training?
The center uses a state-of-the-art computer modeling simulator of a 12-module NuScale SMR control room to provide real-world nuclear power plant operation scenarios.
How does this initiative benefit NuScale Power Corp?
By fostering a skilled workforce and promoting its SMR technology, NuScale strengthens its market position and supports the global energy transition to carbon-free solutions.
 Read the original press release here.

author: @infoitsport
title: Errani e Vavassori: Trionfo Storico agli US Open nel Doppio Misto
text: [ ](/a/17D4C4C2-EFF6-4E4F-B7BB-292390C4895B/Errani-Vavassori-nella-storia-vincono-Us-Open-doppio-misto) [Leggi](https://www.lagazzettadelmezzogiorno.it/news/ultima-ora/1533237/errani-vavassori-nella-storia-vincono-us-open-doppio-misto.html) Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori hanno scritto una pagina indelebile nella storia del tennis italiano. Nella finale del doppio misto degli US Open, disputata sull'Arthur Ashe Stadium di New York, hanno sconfitto la coppia americana composta da Taylor Townsend e Donald Young con il punteggio di 7-6, 7-5. Questo risultato li consacra come la prima coppia italiana a vincere un titolo del Grande Slam in questa categoria. Il percorso verso la vittoria non è stato semplice. La partita è stata caratterizzata da momenti di grande tensione e intensità. Nel primo set, gli azzurri hanno dimostrato una notevole capacità di gestione dei momenti cruciali, imponendosi al tie-break con un netto 7-0. Nel secondo set, dopo un equilibrio iniziale, Errani e Vavassori hanno realizzato il break decisivo sul 6-5, chiudendo così l'incontro. Questo trionfo rappresenta un'importante conferma del talento e della determinazione dei due tennisti italiani. Sara Errani, già nota per i suoi successi in singolare e in doppio femminile, ha aggiunto un altro prestigioso titolo al suo palmarès. Andrea Vavassori, dal canto suo, ha dimostrato di essere un partner ideale, capace di sostenere la pressione dei grandi palcoscenici. La vittoria di Errani e Vavassori si inserisce in un contesto di crescente successo per il tennis italiano. Negli ultimi anni, il movimento tennistico azzurro ha visto emergere numerosi talenti in tutte le specialità. Jannik Sinner, Matteo Berrettini e Lorenzo Musetti sono solo alcuni dei nomi che stanno portando l'Italia ai vertici del tennis mondiale.
